channel.title: Procedural Generation Toolkit for Unity
channel.description: Recent content on Procedural Generation Toolkit for Unity

item.title: Scope
item.description: To give context, Unity is a cross-platform 2D/3D game engine with a powerful IDE for developers to create games. The toolkit software supports the development of content creation in Unity. The generation toolkit would procedurally generate 2D or 3D maps that game developers can use in their own games without having to implement their own procedural generation algorithms. This toolkit takes in inputs and parameters from the user, such as which algorithm to use, the randomness parameters, seed, assets/textures, etc.

item.title: Features
item.description: The Static Generation system feature consisted of two major use cases. Use case B: “Configuring and Parametrizing Procedural Generation Algorithms for Static Generation” (see Section 2.2.2) and use case C: “Generation for Static Content Creation” (see Section 2.2.3). Use case B involves the situation where the user picks PGA and fulfills its input of choice. This use case is to ensure that the data type and values of the chosen PGA are correct in order to successfully describe the characteristics of the generation.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Syntax highlighting and menus can be configured via config.toml.

item.title: Hugo Whisper
item.description: Whisper is a minimal documentation theme built for Hugo. The design & functionality is intentionally minimal.
